main event: Three red and green (alternating) objects were seen in the northeast and southwest through binoculars over a period of several nights.
interesting points: The objects were visible for one to two hours nightly., The sighting occurred from September 4 to October 7, 1955., Observers included a farmer and a service station attendant in La Grande, Iowa., Lights on the objects were described as steady green and flashing red., The investigation concluded that the sightings could be a misinterpretation of astronomical objects.
sighted object: Three red and green flashing lights
witness description: A farmer and a service station attendant
